text: Maurice Dayan (25 January 1935 – 2 May 2020) was a French psychoanalyst and university professor. He taught psychology at the University of Montpellier, then at Paris Descartes University. Dayan then was a professor of psychopathology at Université Sorbonne Paris Nord, then at Paris Diderot University. From 1995 to 2000, he directed the Laboratoire de psychanalyse et de psychopathologie, which was created by Laplanche in 1970. Dayan died on 2 May 2020 at the age of 85. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2020 deaths Category:French academics Category:Scientists from Paris Category:Psychoanalysts from Europe
title: Maurice Dayan
